content.description: Left hand on good in-cut crimp from Fragile term then right hand on the spiky crimp then up to the gaston rail match and go way up to the jug!
content.location: right to the left of “changling low”

content.description: Sit start on the low pocket on the arete and traverse past Grace Face and into Wheel Well. Nice because you don't eliminate any holds, do a big shouldery move and then do Wheel Well. Grade is approximate because I am very tall and others might find the middle much harder.

Start to the right of the

Diagonal Ramp

on a kindof jug and traverse left finishing up Grace Face.
content.protection: You only really need a couple pads for the Don’t Worry be Slappy part because it gets taller and there’s a rock under you.

content.description: This original problem is no longer possible due to Orange Buddha shifting onto its side in 2017. Start on lowest holds of overhang and make your way out to the lip. Traverse right to jug at the far end.
What's left of Orange Buddha Arete since the rock tilted in 2017.  Sit start ~V4/5 or stand start ~V2/3.
content.location: Face right of what used to be Orange Buddha Arete.

content.description: Start seated with right hand on big undercling and left hand on face crimp. Climb into sit start for the regular Orange Buddha Arete problem.

This climb is no longer possible due to Orange Buddha shifting onto its side in 2017.

Climb depends on sand levels. Best when sand is high. when sand is low there is a jagged rock right behind you. Sit start on low holds and climb up the arete feature. This climb has several variations.

Starting about 4 feet left of the diagnol crack on a very low flat hold, pull up and up until you top out.

That's me putting my shoe on in the beta photo, the climb starts up and left of my left shoulder.
content.protection: You will certainly want a crash pad or two (if the sand is low) to soften the landing.  There's a flat rock lying beneath the problem.

content.description: Start low on Diagonal Ramp, traverse left into Grace Face and finish it out.
Start on big diagonal rail and ascend using sloppers, crimps and pinches
content.protection: Pads. Careful of the rock behind the climb

content.description: Start on good, low rail and power out to jug half way up.
The very obvious diagonal crack system on the right side of the boulder. Big holds take up a little ways then lunge up top (or use the crimpy intermediate).
content.protection: Sands been washed away with this last storm, landing is just rocks now, bring a pad.

content.description: Located just right of the diagnol crack, this problem pretty much just doesn't use the big holds that the V1 uses.  Its pretty crimpy, but fun none-the-less.
content.protection: Nothing but soft sand underneath.  I suggest beer.

content.description: Sit-start with a left sidepull, right Gaston then work up using more sidepulls and the arete to the right to the jug on top. Easy top-out.
content.protection: A couple pads and maybe a spotter as there a couple painful-looking boulders right below.
content.location: Around the corner from Grace Face, on the uphill side of the boulder

content.description: Start low on a big pocket. Make some hard moves up the arete and left to the headwall using side pulls to gain the jug at the top.
content.protection: Rocky Landing. Pads and your strongest pair of ankles.
content.location: Northeast most arete. Left of Kiki's Big Adventure.

content.description:
Climb the shield feature starting on the jug rail.

Here's a video prior to the boulder shifting, decreasing the grade from v11 to what is now v10.
content.location: West face of Orange Buddha Boulder

content.description: start right or Orange Buddha Arete on a LH fat pinch and RH incut crimp. Traverse/campus on decent holds with no feet to the start of Orange Buddha Arete and finish it
content.protection: a few pads, maybe a spotter
content.location: Danger Boulder, by Orange Buddha Arete

content.description: Climb the problem left of the diagonal crack. Start on obvious low holds, make move out right to slopey gastone and establish yourself in the undercling before making the moves to the top.
content.location: north face of orange buddha boulder

content.description: Start on two crimps cross to another, match and then do a few more easier moves. A lot of the feet for the first move are choss fyi. Has seen some breakages so grade might be changing.
content.protection: Two pads is nice. Could do with one.
content.location: Start on two crimps and go up. Climb is pretty obvious and refer to the photo. To the left of “The Changeling Low”
